description.summary: The Camino Sanabrés starts in Granja de Moreruela and runs to Santiago de Compostella.@en
description.text: The Camino Sanabrés starts in Granja de Moreruela and follows the royal road between Meseta and Galacia, reaching Santiago de Compostella from the South. It is often used by pilgrims on the Vía de la Plata as a final stage to Santiago de Compostella. The route is less tavelled than the major caminos and has a reputation for being peaceful and gentle.@en

notes.text: The Camino Sanabrés is an uncrowded route and does not offer the same level of pilgrim services as the more popular routes. Accommodation and services can be sparse and pilgrims will need careful planning and an ability to adapt to circumstances.@en

events.description: Cea is famous for a bread made according to a 700 year old receipe. It is one of the four Spanish breads with a protected geographical indication.@en

notes.text: This hostel is approximately 1km from O Reino on the N-525.
